info.title: InsuranceNow API
info.description:
InsuranceNow's RESTful API is built according to the OpenAPI specification and provides access to InsuranceNow functionality.
Developers can use the API to integrate InsuranceNow with portals and other third-party systems.

_revision.description: Revision of this resource used to detect update conflicts. Send the value received from a `GET` as the value in a `PUT`. The value is unused when creating new resources (`POST`) and may be omitted. The value should be considered opaque and its generation algorithm may change in the future. As such, do not store the value for longer than needed (e.g. not longer than a user interaction).

In addition to id, an optional context field allows a single parent (e.g. ProductRiskType) to refer to several ProductScheduledPremiumModSet beans, even with the same id, in different contexts. For example, a building ProductRiskType may refer to the "Property" set for both the "Building" and "Contents" context, but a different "TimeElement" set for the "BusinessIncome" context. Context should be unique within ProductScheduledPremiumModSetRefs to avoid ambiguous references.

classCode.description: The Class Code field contains a two-digit code that represents the specific class of a vehicle.

curbWeight.description: The Curb Weight field is a five-position field containing the curb weight of the vehicle in pounds. This field is used primarily for cars, and for trucks beginning with model year 2003.

dayTimeRunningLights.description: The Daytime Running Light Indicator identifies whether the vehicle has factory installed Daytime Running Lights (DRL) as either standard or optional equipment.

effectiveYrMonth.description: Effective Year and Month of the vehicle rating value.

electronicStabilityControl.description: The Electronic Stability Control Indicator specifies whether the vehicle has Electronic Stability Control as standard or optional equipment.

endingYrMonth.description: Ending Year and Month of the vehicle rating value.

engineType.description: The Engine Indicator specifies whether the accompanying engine is a special type of engine. The possible values for the Engine Indicator are: B-Turbo Hybrid Engine,D-Diesel Engine,F-Flexible Fuel,H-Hybrid Engine,N-Natural Gas Engine,T-Turbo Engine,X-Turbo Diesel Engine,Y-Turbo Bio-Diesel Engine

fourWheelDrive.description: The Four-Wheel Drive Indicator field is a one-digit field that contains a *4* if the vehicle is a four-wheel drive, or a *blank if the vehicle is not four-wheel drive.

modelSeriesInformation.description: The Model/Series Special Information field describes the Model Name or Series of the vehicle. This field is only used when additional Model or Series information is necessary in determining a unique rating value.

ncicMake.description: The NCIC Make Code field contains the NCIC (National Crime Information Center) four-digit abbreviation of the make for the vehicle (e.g. EGIL = Eagle).

otherInformation.description: The Other Special Information field contains a four-digit code that describes information that does not fit into the five previously described categories. This field is only used when other information is necessary in determining a unique symbol.

payloadCapacity.description: The Payload Capacity field contains the payload capacity of the vehicle in pounds. Payload Capacity includes the weight of the driver, passengers, optional equipment, and cargo. This calculation was performed for the following class codes: small utility, large utility, small pickups, large pickups, and vans.

performance.description: Vehicle Performance (i.e. Standard, Sporty, Intermediate, High)

restraintInformation.description: The Restraint Special Information field describes the Restraint System of the vehicle. This field is only used when restraint information is necessary in determining a unique rating value.

specialInformation.description: The Special Information fields provide vehicle characteristics that are used to differentiate vehicles when you are performing a search based on the vehicle description, and not the VIN. In cases where the Model Name, Body Style (including doors), and Engine information are not sufficient to identify a unique symbol, Special Information is required to make this distinction

tonnage.description: The Tonnage Indicator specifies the tonnage and weight ranges for vehicles in the following class codes: small utility, large utility, small pickups, large pickups, and vans.

vinPrefix.description: First 8 characters of the vin plus the check digit and model year digit

wheelBase.description: The Wheelbase field is a five-position field with a decimal point in the fourth position. This position represents the Wheelbase of a vehicle rounded to the nearest tenth

futureStatusCd.description: Indicates a bean pulled back to an OOS endorsement (Future or FutureTerm)

preferredDeliveryMethod.description: The preferred method for output delivery

JWT.description:
JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme.
Note: The header value *must* begin with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the JWT. For example: `Bearer eyJ0...cQ6w`
